meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: PROTESTS

div.a: The Hidden Causes Of The Muslim Protests

div.div: As the Muslim protests subside, more and more people have come to realize that what seems to have sparked them--one of the worst YouTube videos ever, which is saying something--isn't what they were mainly about.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RVFyOC&via=Digg&text=The Hidden Causes Of The Muslim Protests

div.div: LOOK US IN THE EYE AND SAY THAT

div.a: How Eye Contact Quells Online Hostility

div.div: A new study suggests that above and beyond anything else, we're nasty on the Internet because we don't make eye contact with our compatriots.
TERRORISM

div.a: Using Social Media To Combat Terrorism

div.div: The United States, which invented social media, is now at the mercy of physical attack inspired by social media. What will it take for us to get into this game?
BESPOKE BODY PARTS

div.a: Scientists Make Progress In Tailor-Made Organs

div.div: For the most part the promise of bioartificial organs has remained a science-fiction fantasy. Now, however, researchers are building organs with a different approach, using the body’s cells and letting the body itself do most of the work
AVIATION

Twenty-one months after China’s Chengdu aerospace firm unveiled its J-20 jet fighter prototype — Beijing’s first stealth warplane — the rival Shenyang company has revealed what appears to be a competing, radar-evading plane.
NO FANS ON THE FIELD

div.a: The Facebook Post That Got An NFL Referee Pulled From A Game

div.div: One would assume that the NFL wouldn't allow fans to referee professional football games. But you know what they say about making assumptions, right?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RWOUEb&via=Digg&text=The Facebook Post That Got An NFL Referee Pulled From A Game

div.div: NO MORE TEACHERS, NO MORE BOOKS

At a time when the value of a college degree is being called into question, and when job prospects for many new graduates are grimmer than they’ve been in years, perhaps it’s no surprise to see a not-back-to-school movement spring up. What is surprising is where it’s springing up, and who’s behind it.
APPLE

div.a: The Custom Chip Powering The iPhone 5

div.div: What makes the new iPhone 5 so fast? Take a closer look at the new A6 chip from Apple.
POWER

div.a: The Time Has Come For Nuclear Fusion

div.div: Harnessing nuclear fusion to create cheap, safe and sustainable energy used to be a futuristic joke. But its day is almost upon us.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rac13Q&via=Digg&text=The Time Has Come For Nuclear Fusion

div.div: POLITICS

div.a: Israeli PM Uses Football To Explain His Concerns With Iran

div.div: What's a world leader concerned with a nuclear Iran going to do to explain his concerns to Americans? Use a football analogy, of course.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PHRNfP&via=Digg&text=Israeli PM Uses Football To Explain His Concerns With Iran

div.div: ARMSTRONG

div.a: Why Lance Armstrong Will Never Give In

div.div: With evidence piling up that Armstrong cheated to win, should he confess and ask his fans, enemies, and cancer-fighting supporters to forgive him?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UTd6vm&via=Digg&text=Why Lance Armstrong Will Never Give In

div.div: COMPLAINTS

div.a: Twitter: The New Old Customer Service?

div.div: Have a complaint? Forget calling customer service, try tweeting instead.
ARTSY SCREEN SMUDGES
It turns out that greasy gunk your fingers leave on touch screens can actually be considered art.
TECH

div.a: Friendster Founder Wants To Bring You Your Tech News

div.div: Friendster founder Jonathan Abrams beta-launched Nuzzel, his own social news aggregator this week.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QcF9Tp&via=Digg&text=Friendster Founder Wants To Bring You Your Tech News

div.div: BAD NEWS

div.a: And Now Let Us Gasp In Astonishment At What Just Happened To The Newspaper Business

div.div: Over the past decade, lots of big newspaper companies have gone bust. But when you take a look at what's happened to newspaper advertising over that period, it's a wonder they all haven't.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QhLoId&via=Digg&text=And Now Let Us Gasp In Astonishment At What Just Happened To The Newspaper Business

div.div: IT'S WHAT'S ON THE INSIDE THAT MATTERS

div.a: Why Journalists Love Reddit For Its Brains, Not Just Its Beauty

div.div: While Reddit’s influence in politics may be growing, and its role in shaping internet culture is already significant, there’s another area of life that also relies heavily on the site: journalism.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RZXfeK&via=Digg&text=Why Journalists Love Reddit For Its Brains, Not Just Its Beauty

div.div: PERKS

div.a: Marissa Mayer Just Gave Every Yahoo Employee A New Smartphone

div.div: New Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer just sent an email to all of Yahoo's full time and part time employees in the US, promising them a new Apple, Samsung, Nokia, or HTC smartphone.

li.div: Remember when a Blackberry was the de rigueur business phone? Yahoo is basically paying its employees not to use one. businessinsider.com/mariss...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U0pFaq&via=Digg&text=Marissa Mayer Just Gave Every Yahoo Employee A New Smartphone

div.div: ADVERTISING

div.a: Samsung Tries To Win On Merit In New Ad Campaign

div.div: Samsung thinks their Galaxy S III can compete with Apple's iPhone, and has launched a national ad campaign to prove it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pu0B5v&via=Digg&text=Samsung Tries To Win On Merit In New Ad Campaign
